For the finding Firefox procedure you could use:

if(FindWindowTitlePart('Mozilla', False))then begin

It shortens the code but if you want to load bitmaps to lag then ignore me…

item.title: Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron
item.dc:creator: @r_ch_e r!ch!e
item.description:
@r_ch_e wrote:

you should get the script to click at the very top left corner. then drag to the very bottom corner. then click enter.
runs evry program in the desktop.

Also try to disable the windows button on the keyboard. Otherwise press windows key +L (logs off), the log on as someone else. Then use the task manager to shutdown scar.

Read full topic
item.source: Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron

item.title: Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron
item.dc:creator: @Loosyloo Loosyloo
item.description:
@Loosyloo wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:1, topic:7077”][center][size=15pt]Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron[/size][/center]

Try to shut this script off!

USE AT YOUR OWN RISK! BEFORE YOU RUN THIS SCRIPT. I AM NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR WHAT HAPPENS TO YOUR COMPUTER. BY RUNNING THIS SCRIPT YOU ARE SAYING THAT YOU ARE IN SOUND MIND AND WILL NOT TAKE ANY ACTION AGAINST THE AUTHOR FOR ANY DAMAGES. I HAVE TESTED THIS SCRIPT ON MY COMPUTER, AND THE WORST IT DID WAS SHUT IT DOWN.

For this script to work, you need Firefox. And then just run it. Don’t worry about using the target, it works good. Remember, the aim of this, is to try to shut this crazy thing off. Remember… if the script catches you opening task manager, it will ‘penalize’ you. Better be careful. Have fun.

Shutting down your computer by pressing the shutdown button is cheating lol. Don’t use that!

[scar]
{.Script Info:

ScriptName = Try To Shut This Script Off

Author = Ron from moparisthebest.com

Description = Save everything on your computer before running this.

Version = .11 beta - works but I want to add more.

Date = July 30, 2006

Notes = If you want a friend to use this. Make sure to …

           Change the Program Name, Change these comments, and make
           fake procedures. :)

Requirements: You must have Firefox to be able to run this…

Any bugs? Post on Mopar’s Forums.

BEFORE YOU RUN THIS SCRIPT. I AM NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR WHAT HAPPENS TO YOUR

COMPUTER. BY RUNNING THIS SCRIPT YOU ARE SAYING THAT YOU ARE IN SOUND MIND
AND WILL NOT TAKE ANY ACTION AGAINST THE AUTHOR FOR ANY DAMAGES. I HAVE TESTED THIS
SCRIPT ON MY COMPUTER, AND THE WORST IT DID WAS SHUT IT DOWN.
/Script Info}

Program TryToShutThisScriptOff;

// Declare Variables.
Var
x, y, x2, y2, Firefox, FirefoxIcon, TaskManager : Integer;

// Declare the BMPs.
Procedure LoadBMPs;
Begin
Firefox := BitmapFromString(4, 4, ‘z78DA7375757572717432424’ +
‘057375747174B64116220A62E5757A088230049E51698’);
FirefoxIcon := BitmapFromString(4, 4, ‘AE451DC1663149372F39’ +
‘75A0D4682EE85D0BE7B27730698FF1D19AE3D2A0577F8A317EAEB’ +
‘79D785C6D6E286F98338CC4’);
TaskManager := BitmapFromString(28, 1, ‘z78DA333030B4747633’ +
‘30373674B130343373747535B030357571717576B574B1C0455A1’ +
‘A5A3A01B581A02B32895F1779A4B99BA58B932500998D29B0’);
End;

// Procedure CrazyMouse to make the mouse jump everywhere!
Procedure CrazyMouse;
Var i : Integer;
Begin
// Get your clients dimensions.
GetClientDimensions(x2, y2);
// For i equals 1 to 10 do this…
For i := 1 to 10 do
Begin
// Move mouse randomly
MoveMouse(Random(x2), Random(y2));
// Add 1 to i each time until it equals 10.
i := i + 1;
End;
End;

// If firefox isn’t detected then it will open it in on your desktop, if
// the desktop icon isn’t found, then it will run it!
Procedure FindFirefox;
Begin
// If the Firefox secret icon isn’t seen then…
If(Not(FindBitmap(Firefox, x, y)))Then
Begin
// Insult you.
WriteLn(‘You bitch! Firefox isn’‘t open!’);
// Lifts the buttons… Ctrl and N so they won’t interfere with
// the horrific scar script.
KeyUp(17);
KeyUp(78);
// Look for the Bitmap Firefox Icon which may be on your desktop.
If(FindBitmap(FirefoxIcon, x, y))Then
Begin
// If found, then double click on it.
ClickMouse(x, y, True);
Wait(5);
ClickMouse(x, y, True);
// Small wait, or it will keep trying to open it.
// We don’t want that because it messes with the other procedures.
Wait(100);
// Otherwise…
End Else
Begin
// Open the run window.
KeyDown(92);
KeyDown(82);
KeyUp(82);
KeyUp(92);
// small wait.
wait(100);
// Send this in.
SendKeys(‘C:Program FilesMozilla Firefoxfirefox.exe’);
// Hit enter.
SendKeys(Chr(13));
// Start CrazyMouse to penalize you.
CrazyMouse;
// Scold you.
WriteLn(‘Oh ho ho ho, you don’‘t have a Firefox icon on your desktop!’);
End;
// Otherwise…
End Else
Begin
// Press and Hold Ctrl+N to open new windows.
KeyDown(17);
KeyDown(78);
End;
End;

// If Task Manager is found then KILL IT!
Procedure FindTaskManager;
Begin
If(FindBitmap(TaskManager, x, y))Then
Begin
// Press Alt+F4 to kill Task Manager.
KeyDown(18);
KeyDown(115);
KeyUp(18);
KeyUp(115);
// Start CrazyMouse to penalize you.
CrazyMouse;
// Scold you.
WriteLn(‘You get penalized for opening task manager! Shame on you!’);
End;
End;

// Main loop which is repeated.
Procedure MainLoop;
Begin
FindFirefox;
FindTaskManager;
End;

Begin
// Clear debug box.
ClearDebug;
// Load Bitmaps.
LoadBMPs;
// Minimize the application.
GetApplication.MINIMIZE;
// Click somewhere for the hell of it.
ClickMouse(500, 500, True);
// Repeat this part only!
Repeat
MainLoop;
// Until the F14 button is down lol! Have fun!!!
Until(IsFKeyDown(14))
End.
[/scar]

As a side note: On my computer this script not only opens up firefox, but seems to open lots of things. I don’t know how I did it, but I like the effect. I hope I don’t turn it off in future version.

~Ron :D[/quote][br][size=1]Posted at: December 20, 2006, 05:20:20 AM[/size][hr]Took me 1 min…

Read full topic

That is why.

    GetPage('http://www.google.com');
  End;
End.

~Ron

item.source: Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron

item.title: Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“gokon, post:38, topic:7077”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=9836.msg113375#msg113375 date=1154459874]
Maybe if you set it so once it detects someone pressing ctrl+alt, it presses a random letter (besides s), and interupts the shortcut?
[/quote]
you’d have to also make sure it doesn’t press “A” because Ctrl+Alt+A pauses the script which would let you close the script. :P[/quote]
Yeah I could have done a lot of things, but this was just for fun, and frankly I had so many versions of this script, and I seemed to add a little too much and the script woul take too long to check for each. I should have added While Loops to make it work, but then it turned out to be more work than fun, you know?

Read full topic
item.source: Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron

item.title: Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron
item.dc:creator: @gokon gokon
item.description:
@gokon wrote:

Zach1188:

Maybe if you set it so once it detects someone pressing ctrl+alt, it presses a random letter (besides s), and interupts the shortcut?

you’d have to also make sure it doesn’t press “A” because Ctrl+Alt+A pauses the script which would let you close the script.

item.source: Try To Shut This Script Off v.11 by Ron
